2,5/ 5

author: {'steamid': '76561197972323502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1657327044}
review: this game was great fun.  feels like a cross between DDR and Persona.  I enjoyed the dialogue in the game and the voice acting was really good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004981688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 942, 'last_played': 1653016178}
review: A rhythm game with a twist. The gameplay is interesting, the writing is superb (lots of witty banter, and the item descriptions are awesome), the characters are funny, the art is gorgeous, and there's plenty of good music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047988034', 'num_games_owned': 2204, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1388178395}
review:
I'd call it DDRPG: A mix of DDR and RPG.
It adds cool things to the regular arrow game: Exp and levels, monsters to fight, items to collect and combine, magic spells and a touch of strategy. But what makes this game worthy are its dialogs (with a good voice acting) and descriptions of the items. Trust me, you'll laugh your ass off xD
Oh, it has 5 difficulty modes so it's not only for pros, don't worry.
You can even play it with a dance mat! But I recommend you to play it with a regular gamepad.
Of course there's always a downside: there are few songs and most of them are meh. An option to play with your own MP3s would have been a nice adition.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966370175', 'num_games_owned': 2874, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2061, 'last_played': 1364799600}
review:
Very decent and entertaining indie game if you like musical DDR like, works perfectly with a 360 pad, certainly with a dance pad/guitar also; I would recommend to play it on hard difficulty to get familiar with ("interesting" enough). 
The triptic panels system is an excellent idea (Spell/Defense/Mana), way less boring than the traditional single view/plethora of notes flowing down the screen, since you have 3 times more to deal with...  
The fly in the ointment is the lack of multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046469524', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1396232302}
review: Sequence is a rhythm based, story driven RPG that follows the story of Ky and his 'handler' Maya as they traverse a tower full of strange creatures, 'guardians,' and internet memes. It's a rather fun experience with great writing and a catchy soundtrack, although it can drag at times as you try to obtain the correct items for a portion / spell. Definitely worth a buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003511012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1127, 'last_played': 1591588078}
review: I've never particularly been big on rhythm games, but this one is really unique. It's got some really great dialogue and voice acting, an intriguing story and a very simple and easy to use method of play. There's also a brilliant prize for those of you who stick it out till the very end - plus a good share of secrets and hiddens. Definitely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970400690', 'num_games_owned': 2439, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1164, 'last_played': 1391512801}
review:
This is the best attempt at combining two genres I've ever seen! The rythm and fun of a music game combined with the battles and sense of progress from an RPG, the elements from each genre complement each other so well that you'll be amazed why this wasn't done earlier. And there's no skimping on the greatness from both genres either. The music is great'funk'tastic, and the story still got me wondering even after I've completed it.

It's games like these that actually impresses in an indie market full ofgames trying to impress!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012436829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1516101417}
review: This is a really good rhythm game mixed with RPG elements, it is a surprisingly good mix, where the spells you cast are the notes. it's definitely a game i can recommend for people that love either genre. the story is also pretty good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994345983', 'num_games_owned': 1138, 'num_reviews': 484, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1361865600}
review: The game is basically DDR with RPG elements so you can craft drops from enemies to better your stats or learn more spells and harder monsters drop better items. Combat makes you cycle between defence, attack and mana regen modes which is interesting because it means it isn't just about hitting notes on time. Humour is really funny in between combat, characters all look nice and the music is great. HOWEVER the RPG element shoots itself in the foot when you find yourself having to grind the same level 40 time with the same song over and over again because you are trying to get some stupid item with a low drop rate to advance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967658060', 'num_games_owned': 1732, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1384440910}
review: Great gameplay, good fun, nice music. But dumb story and really amateur voice acting (that's excused due to the low selling price though!). A real sleeper hit.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967608196', 'num_games_owned': 748, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1360656000}
review:
If you like DDR-esque games this could be a good choice for you.  It has good writing and passable voice acting to go alongside it.  The gameplay is novel and has some tactical depth to it as well.

It is however a very obvious straight console port.  Without an analog stick you cannot preview spells before casting them, making it difficult to tell when you have enough mana without simply memorizing the mana costs.

Another negative is the fact that it has no volume controls in the game at all, and the sound effects are kindof terrible.  The music seemed okay I guess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011673436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1368255600}
review: This is an awesome rhythm action/rpg hybrid.  Totally worth $5, or you can wait for it to go on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044703551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1394905351}
review:
All right, they totally made a hipster-themed Stepmania RPG that feels like it was targeted specifically at redditors...

... and I'm enjoying this more than I should be willing to admit!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040859498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1357286400}
review: 3/5 Stars. Basically, it's Dance Dance Revolution for your fingertips. The storyline is weak but offers a sassy dialog, and the gameplay becomes challenging, scaling smoothly from your starting point in simple introductory mode. The graphics are dull as dishwater. Not my cup of tea but it might be yours if you like click-games akin to Bejewelled, but are seeking a little more focus and thought.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978810807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1953, 'last_played': 1457397509}
review: This is a Rhythm/ RPG. If you have played guitar hero u get the idea, except you hit the notes when the MUSIC says to, not when the screen says it (like u do in guitar hero/rockband). Theres loot, crafting and levels. and then... theres humor, the humor made me stay. items have humor, the dialogue has humor, and if u watch the videos on the store page, they have humor 2. I wanna try this with a dance pad. I cant wait to see what else Iridium Studios comes out with next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017304485', 'num_games_owned': 530, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1358150400}
review: Nice combination of RPG and rhythm/music game. The story so far is awesome and the music quite good. But sadly, you can't use your own music. I can still recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009349806', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1357459200}
review: As someone who isn't very talented when it comes to rhythm games, I yelled obscenities rather often during my experience with Sequence. But with the intriguing story, funny banter, and amazing soundtrack, my lack of coordination still couldn't keep me away. Well worth the price, whatever it may be, and with an insightful and personal audio recording during the credits after the finale (from the writer / voice of main protagonists!) I eagerly look forward to what else comes from Iridium Studios. They've gained a fan!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994909078', 'num_games_owned': 2604, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1352361600}

review: Awesome game, especially for such a low price. A lot of fun, challenging, and interesting. It takes a little bit to get the hang of, but once you do it's a major time waster.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999143487', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1356163200}
review:
If you are not musically challenged, you should play Sequence, it's currently the best (and only) Rhythm RPG out there. 
It plays like any DDR-like game, where arrows fall down the screen and you have to clear them on the beat of the music. But instead of one stream of arrows, there are three: the HP stream, where every missed arrow causes you to take damage; the MP stream, where every hit note regenerates some MP; and the Spell stream, where you have to hit every note to execute a spell successfully. 
The dialogue is clever, the art is gorgeous (although it uses sprites), and the item descriptions are hilarious (example: Broken Pencil [Utterly Pointless]). Best of all: it's only ‚Ç¨3,99, and even as low as ‚Ç¨0,99 during sales. Buy one ice-cream less this year and get Sequence.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025019149', 'num_games_owned': 586, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1395188480}

review: This game combines the genre of Reflex-rhythm-beat games and RPG. I wish there was more games like it! If you enjoy a rhythm game with great techno-like music, try it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993236460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1036, 'last_played': 1355558400}
review: Phenomenal rhythm game. Really, the most enjoyable I've ever played besides DDR. It suffers from....bizarre dialogue and plot, occasionally funny, sometimes offensive in odd ways, but the design of the game is truly great. If you like rhythm games this is an absolute must.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006786258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1097, 'last_played': 1680677268}
review: Stepmania/DDR meets Final Fantasy. No joke. If you like RPGs and Rhythm games, look no further.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018515086', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1385551602}
review: Se vuelve bastante repetitivo, pero no dura mucho y es bastante original. Merece la pena aunque sea por probar el concepto.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990293586', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1561749103}
review:
A rhythm game with RPG elements. Dafuq? It's a decently fun game, worth a couple bucks. Contains a metric fuckton of grinding, weird controls, an incredible amount of grinding, annoying issues like not being able to skip bits where it noisily adds or subtracts your XP, and a colossal shitton of grind. I suppose the few artists featured here thought they might be promoting their music. Instead, you will end up hating every bit of it because of how much you have to replay shit. Also it's very grindy.

"Game of the year!" -- Grindy McGrinderton, Grindcore Gaming Magazine

author: {'steamid': '76561197968278647', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1384470481}
review:
Sequence is a fun but simple DDR-style rhythm game with just enough uniqueness to keep the 10 hours it takes to reach 100% completion interesting. Its voice acted narrative, level-up system, and loot and inventory elements help it rise above its fundamentally repetitive nature. Several NPCs have some really great dialogue, which kept me eager to push through to the next story scene. 

It would have been nice to have a lot more variety in the music, but thankfully the handful of tracks, especially Ronald Jankee‚Äôs work, are all great. Considering only two people made the game (and it only cost me $1.25), Sequence was and is a memorable experience worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975672865', 'num_games_owned': 802, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1414458466}
review: The combat system is just amazing. It adds purpose and depth to the already tried and true DDR formula. Unfortunately this game suffers from what I call Indie syndrome. Iridium simply could not afford the polish needed to fully realize Sequence's potential. The RPG elements could have been more robust and it would have been nice to have a larger catalog than just one artist. However these shortcomings do not take away from the experience, making this a must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997711695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1442814442}
review:
Combat DDR. Brilliant. The plot is mediocre, and you can get a bit bored of some of the music since you're often forced to grind the same song repeatedly to progress, but the gameplay is novel and very entertaining.

Now if I could just control spellcasting with a wireless controller and use a dance pad instead of a keyboard for arrow-stomping, I could play this for thousands of hours. It's not a far conceptual leap to PvP, either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010236168', 'num_games_owned': 952, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1386347623}
review:
8/10
This is the good ol' dance pad game, except you use your keyboard or controller (recommended) to push the right buttons at the right time.
You have 3 different... let's call them "beat displays":
One is for mana (which you need for your attacks or for healing yourself), one is for your attack/s and one is for blocking the enemy's attacks.

The story is the average "You wake up in a strange place, want to get out of there and have to play by the rules of your abductor" one, but it's still interesting and funny.

Conversations between the main character and NPCs sometimes refer to websites like 4chan and YouTube, memes like "That's what she said" and "Yo dawg..." and sometimes they even make jokes below the belt you might have heard before.

The game's soundtrack is quite repetitive, but it has a lot of good tracks that are worth it.

You like playing with music? Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005548695', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 3133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1036, 'last_played': 1531825970}
review: An interesting game that places RPG elements with dance-step style gameplay ... it's fun, it's addictive and has an awesome storyline, with surprising twists ... I think anyone who enjoys that kind of thing, would enjoy this game immensely ... and an excellent game for only 4 bucks :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198040220735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1388692360}
review:
What is sequence? I had no idea when I got this game but when i played it I was amazed. The best way to describe it is an RPG crossed with DDR (Dance Dance Revolution). I gotta say I love the idea of having to swap between lanes in order to attack the enemy or to block  an enemys attack. The only downfall to this game is its lack of a selection of music, (and in a music based game this is a bit of an issue) instead it repeats the same 9-10 songs for each battle. E.G. could you imagine DDR or guitar hero with just 10 songs?

See also:
DDR
Guitar Hero

author: {'steamid': '76561198026810366', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1626575651}

author: {'steamid': '76561197964009814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 339, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1349593200}
review:
Not my kind of game.  You combat bad guys by using one of three panels.  Spells to attack/defense, gain mana, and defend.

Basically you use a controller or keyboard to press arrows as they fall, like a DDR for your fingers.  Unfortunately I could not see myself enjoying it.

I can see that it is well made, with ingame voice acting, and a thought out combat system.... but it is a niche game and this type of niche game is not for me it would seem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058695291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 1062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1384567195}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994312244', 'num_games_owned': 836, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 876, 'last_played': 1384984759}
review:
Sequence est original. Tr√®s original. Si vous avez toujours pas regard√© le video d'explications, c'est principalement jouer √† DDR sur 3 beats/scroll (d√©fense, sort et reg√©n√©ration de mana) avec des m√©caniques de RPG. Le jeu se joue bien avec une manette de Xbox puisqu'il y a d√©j√† un excellent preset. La m√©canique des 3 beats fait en sorte que le jeu est int√©ressant m√™me si manette, contrairement √† DDR. Sur clavier, c'est juste difficile de trouver un setting agr√©able. J'ai pas encore essayer sur mon pad, mais j'ai bien h√¢te. L'histoire est bien √©crite et bourr√©e d'allusions. J'ai bien ris √† plusieurs reprises. Comme pour DDR, il y a plusieurs difficult√©s pour permettre √† tout le monde de pouvoir jouer. Malheuresement le librairie musicale est peu vari√©e et le jeu peut sembler r√©p√©titif. Heureusement il y a plusieurs sorts √† apprendre pour changer les choses. 
Je le recommande √† tout les fans de rhytme games qui cherche de quoi de nouveau!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024474066', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 2233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2141, 'last_played': 1387936856}
review: It's like a rhythm game. With grinding, RPG mechanics,  and amateur voice actors!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043927935', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1657357723}
review:
A quirky and interesting DDR styled RPG. You attack, defend and regenerate MP through hitting notes during a song, and it gets pretty intense at times!

The artwork is very pretty, the music is awesome and memorable, and the gameplay is fun as hell.

The storyline is well crafted, with funny and interesting characters, and some very natural, yet entertaining dialogue. I had a lot of fun with this game, and still come back to replay it from time to time even though i've 100% completed it a couple of times. 

There's a very intriguing meta aspect to the game that only shows itself if you're interested in getting ALL of the achievements. However, I thought what the developer did was novel and impressive, and quite reminiscient of the Portal ARG, but on a smaller scale.

Overall, this is one of the best Indie titles in my game library, and i've got a lot of respect and admiration for what Sequence is, and managed to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998124938', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1436, 'last_played': 1326700800}
review: Tu t'imagines, j'ai pay√© Sequence pour un 1 euro, m√™me pas le prix d'un kebab. Et pourtant, c'est comme si j'avais pay√© une frite fricadelle sauce picalili car il y a √† bouffer plein le jeu. Du genre un gameplay qui tabasse, des dialogues qui tabassent (w√© bon, ils m'ont fait sourire quoi), une OST qui tabasse (Ronald Jenkees, il te fait l'amour aux oreilles avec ses musiques) ... Bref t'as compris, tu vas acheter Sequence ou sinon va te faire violer par une vache folle en rut.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980652769', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1001, 'last_played': 1457114300}
review:
Tr√®s simpa, assez original et, contrairement au jeux de rythme al√©atoire, un gameplay qui tient la route. :)
Un DDR avec un gameplay avanc√©, mais un nombre de musiques limit√©s !
(Assez bonne musique tout du moins)

author: {'steamid': '76561198000808781', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1325664000}
review: Great game, worth the $1.25 fo sho. Think Guitar Hero meets Turn-based RPG. Sounds complicated, but the game does a good job of teaching you everything so you don't feel like the total friggen noob that you are. Stop reading, buy it already!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995584125', 'num_games_owned': 972, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1410232816}
review:
This is an underrated game. I've just completed the game and I was aw struck by the witty clever written dialogue. The grind to collect as much exp as I can and to decide whether I should invest them in creating items or saving them up to level up is a pretty unique idea. I also like the morality script skillfully integrated in the game especially at the end that makes you agree or disagree to some point.

The combat simple is fairly simple to learn and difficult to master and also helps improve your reaction skills and challenges your tactics. I play DDR and ITG so it felt like I was home.

I love some of the music track, could've had more variety but for an indie like this is just amazing.

I hereby rate this game

Score: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197966163970', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1694, 'last_played': 1388786898}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993783503', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1398597140}
review: Funny game - mixture of rythm game and rpg xD

author: {'steamid': '76561197999550057', 'num_games_owned': 602, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1272, 'last_played': 1459716032}
review:
TL;DR: Pure Awesome.

Sequence is a game that most people would ignore. At first glance, its just a Guitar Hero inspired simple shovelware game, right? WRONG. Sequence is a GREAT game, and I will tell you why. 

- The music is fantastic, comming from YouTube legend Ronald Jenkees.
- The switching between screens and casting of spells makes for a great improvement of the otherwise single-minded GH style games. 
- The story is also not to be underestimated. It's more engaging and introspective than most games you will have played. 
- There is a lot of humour to be found in the game; almost every item name and description is a joke.
- Even the credits are engaging and fun to sit through. Great game design from the start of the game until the very end.
- A level of difficulty for everyone, with a good curve.

If you are still not convinced, just watch the trailer and see the greatness of the game and the person behind it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025168052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2242, 'last_played': 1596847610}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993529448', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1461432848}
review:
S√©quence est le fruit de la fusion de Dance Dance Revolution et d'un RPG classique, il faut aimer rentrer des combinaisons de touches tordues qui montent crescendo en complexit√© et en vitesse pour r√©aliser des sort, des contres, et gagner du mana contre le bestiaire du jeu.

Avec des graphismes sympa mais assez statique, une histoire qu'on ne retiendra pas c'est un peu le jeu id√©al pour tuer le temps avant quelque chose de plus consistant. 

En fait le plus dommage c'est de s'√™tre un peu plant√© sur la partie musicale. La plupart des pistes sont aussi planantes que de la musique d'ascenseur, le jeu devient vite lassant faute d'avoir n√©glig√© ce point.

review:
It's an RPG-Rythm game. You have 3 rhythm games at once (arrows dropping down and you need to match them with button presses), one for offense, defense and mana regeneration and you need to multitask between them. 

Between the battles you can choose what kind of attacks you use (some are harder to activate but deal more dmg).

I enjoyed it a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020225902', 'num_games_owned': 1277, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1533672235}
review: As someone who's been playing Dance Dance Revolution emulators on PC since 2003, I drooled at the chance to try this.  I was not disappointed.  In the same way that Puzzle Quest was a role-playing adventure using Bejeweled as its combat system, Sequence is a fun, genuinely hilarious quest that has you playing DDR to represent combat.  This is a lot more creative than it sounds.  You're faced with three streams of arrows; one for offense, one for defense, and one for regaining mana used to fuel your attacks.  Constantly shifting between streams, organizing your list of spells, and seeking out rare materials for crafting new gear is made even more fun by the top quality music, great voice acting, and a script that is much funnier than you'd ever expect.  The $5 price is yet another reason you should add this to your collection.  Don't pass this up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048576278', 'num_games_owned': 1626, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1341730800}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012708447', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1664333226}
review: This game is insanely fun. It can get a little bit repetitive at times, but also really easy to just  chill and "zone out" in. The music, and the humor, are both really great. For the price, it's a must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979693740', 'num_games_owned': 5703, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1508122681}
review:
Imagine playing DDR with your hands and managing three machines at the same time.  That is pretty much the core of this game.  If you like rhythm games that consist of four directions, you might like this.  Essentially, you're juggling three DDR boards, but it's not like there's constant arrows (it does get harder, mind you).  One board is like charging up your mana.  One board is strictly for inputting attacks.  The remaining board is to defend against enemy attacks.

Oh, and I think there's a story here, too, but nobody cares.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054921975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1537952158}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967617403', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1254, 'last_played': 1342335600}
review: One of the most intriguing, and quite honestly BEST, indie games I've ever played.  Combines aspects of RPGs, crafting and Dance-dance revolution style combat using your fingers.  Skip that next trip to the fast food joint and spend it on something worthwhile.  You won't regret the purchase!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998289205', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1454875663}
review: Amazing music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037132481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1341990000}
review:
Here's a strange melding of RPG and rhythm game that shouldn't work as well as it does.  Though I believe the game would be a hard sell to most players based on a description of its gameplay, I also think that's a shame.  Sequence is a wholely unique and worthwhile experience.

Calling Sequence a role-playing game is accurate but also potentially misleading: RPG elements like experience gathering and equipment crafting are a substantial part of gameplay, but, outside of rhythm sections, you'll only be navigating through menus.  There is no exploration and very little to do outside of rhythm battles and item creation.  While this sounds shallow (and perhaps, on the surface, smacks of dumbed-down, "casual" game design) , there's plenty to do thanks to the clever design and balancing of Sequence's underlying mechanics.  The music is great, too! (Though I do wish there was more of it.)

Highly recommended for rhythm fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018351149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1384381052}
review: A great, funny and very different game. The rhythm-game/classic-RPG mash-up works really well even though it does feature quite a bit of grinding. Playing it with a controller is advised

author: {'steamid': '76561198002699255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1546, 'last_played': 1575828910}
review: A fun, music-based, game with witty dialogue and good voice acting.  Althoug it uses music, it's got some RPG aspects to it and the 'combat' requires much more than just hitting the notes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056780727', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1254, 'last_played': 1340521200}
review: I have always been a huge supporter of indie games, so when I heard there was a game that combines RPG elements with music rhythm action I had to check it out. Be forewarned though, Sequence is not for everyone. It's bare-bones design and mildly annoying but sometimes entertaining characters and text descriptions might not appeal to everyone. But for just 5 bucks, it is hard to complain when you getting something unique and quite addictive, if you're into what it has to offer that is. The story is bland and the menus are simplistic but Sequence offers an intense, one-of-a-kind battle system that will leave you wanting more. It even supports the dance pad accessory!

author: {'steamid': '76561198022264921', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1358668800}
review: Pretty fun stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990051969', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1335769200}
review: Puzzle Quest is to Bejeweled as Sequence is to DDR. Sequence is a dungeon crawler / RPG of sorts in which battles are done in DDR-like matches. Of course, arrows are hit with keys instead of a dancepad. The twist is that there are three different playing fields, and you have to switch between them. One regains mana as you hit notes, one blocks incoming damage when you hit the notes, and one is for casting spells. It's an interesting concept, and while it's done very well, it still seems to be amateurish. I'm glad I played it for a bit to get a good idea of the game, but it's not worth the grinding to continue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962436703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1388255329}
review: I liked it a lot. It's hard to put a finger on why because I don't like RPGs or scrolling rhythm games (especially of the directional arrow variety). Definitely worth checking out. Surprisingly the whole game was made by one guy who is also the voice of the protagonist (and all the art/design was done by one girl).

author: {'steamid': '76561197965487582', 'num_games_owned': 786, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 1586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1535927260}
review:
DDR mixed with RPG oddly makes me a happy person.  Despite the limited amount of tracks in the game and the repetitive nature of the game, this really was a blast to play just because of the dialog and writing in it.  Snappy comebacks for everything you say, a sarcastic girl making fun of you at every chance - it's just like real life for me!

Highly recommended for the low price.  Fantastic game that more people need to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055888926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1762, 'last_played': 1416989517}
review:
Fantastic! 

One of the best - and one of a kind.  

Think Guitar Hero, but with an entertaining RPG backstory, geeky in-jokes everywhere, excellent voice acting, stunning artwork AND an excellent new take on the rhythm game mechanic - which requires you to watch and change between 3 separate "streams of notes" while only being able to hit one stream at a time.... 

...so really not all that much like Guitar Hero - much better!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044392134', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1325145600}
review: Awesome and interesting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027623307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1326096000}
review: While the limited soundtrack can get a little tiring, the meat & potatoes of the gameplay and story keep the game fresh and interesting when the music is not.  It's pretty cheap, and there is a lot of enjoyment that you can get out of this title, so pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970307991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1334732400}
review:
Interesting concept with the 3 different screens of arrows you have to switch through.  Tries very hard to be an 'offbeat RPG' like Puzzle Quest, but ultimately the RPG elements are unimportant and the story sequences feature a bunch of flat and emotionless voice actors trying to be hip and witty.

If fanboys of the Matrix got together and tried to film another Matrix with no budget and an all-new script they wrote themselves, the dialogue would probably sound like it does in this game.  It's painful.  If you watch the trailer and listen to one of the devs trying way too hard to be hip while describing the game, you'll understand why it turned out this way.

Sadly the music is a low point as well.  You would think in a game built entirely on timing, music and rhythm that the audio tracks would be a high point, but all of these tracks feel like recycled DDR tunes.

If at some point in your life you *really* enjoyed finger DDR or Stepmania, you might like this game.  Otherwise, skip it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002918839', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1690537381}
review:
I like to call the gameplay in this "Wizardstep," as you cast spells, block attacks, and regenerate mana with three Stepmania/DDR style fields. Gameplay gets hectic and fun quite fast. I would say that this game is also great for improving your coordination in general because of that.

Also, it's FIVE FREAKING DOLLARS. Skip a trip to McDonalds or Starbucks or whatever, and you have enough money left to get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012193401', 'num_games_owned': 4701, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1385106993}
review:
Creative game. Rhythmic RPG game, where you actually fight your battles with rhythm! However, the musics are 'meh'. Well, nice gameplay.

My score: 7/10 (Get it on sale, if you like rhythm games.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197983142469', 'num_games_owned': 508, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1339916400}
review: Surprisingly awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966490441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1480226261}
review: This is a pretty fantastic indie game if you like rhythm games with a bit of story. On the bad side, it carried over some of the 'grinding aspects' from it's JRPG inspiration, but other than that it's great fun. Ronald Jenkees music in particular makes this awesome fun to play. Look up his songs Disorganized fun and Throwing Fire for an idea of the kind of music you'll be playing with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010909133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 1308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1250, 'last_played': 1424699261}
review:
Un jeu surprenant, j'aimais les jeux de rythmes sans en √™tre un grand  fanatique, mais cette histoire de triple zone de rythme simultan√©e rends Sequence unique, dynamique et fortement tactique. 
Autre surprise, le sc√©nario :  Les doublages anglais sont excellents, l'histoire est √©tonnament prenante (surtout pour des cin√©matiques 'fixes' en artwork), et c'est sans compter une bonne touche d'humour ! Je recommanderais donc ce jeu √† part √©gale pour son gameplay et son sc√©nar. Ouais, 50/50 ! Pour un ind√©pendant, c'est d'ailleurs √©tonnant d'avoir une aussi bonne histoire.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999966882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1069, 'last_played': 1387773210}
review: Very fun for those who enjoy rhythm games! The RPG system and humor keeps things fresh and addicting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976482786', 'num_games_owned': 635, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1391109210}
review: Despite my utter loathing of rhythm games in all their various incarnations, I HIGHLY recommend this game. It's easy to play and is as wonderfully sardonic as the trailers are. An indie gem to be sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002403444', 'num_games_owned': 997, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2009, 'last_played': 1643850966}
review: An extremely novel idea executed very well. The story is so-so, and the voice acting feels like it was done by bored devs, but the gameplay and audio really make this a win. It is a mixture of a rythm game and an RPG, which pits you against an oppenent to music where you must hit notes on your gamepad/keyboard in rythm on one of 3 boards to win. 1 board gains mana, 1 casts various spells, and 1 defends on attack. Balancing which spells you take into fights, which boards you focus on, and handling the special abilities that bosses throw at you is a lot of fun. It doesn't hurt that the musical selection is also very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000636344', 'num_games_owned': 1078, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1327305600}
review: De game is uniek en leuk genoeg om je zoet te houden tot de eindstreep. En voor het bedrag wat ik ervoor betaald heb (‚Ç¨1) was het een prima aankoop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010087763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1325664000}
review: i don't like the characters or the gameplay or the visual style and the writing needs a lot of work 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198044915116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1327392000}
review:
A quirky and humourous rhythm/RPG game, Sequence has a lot going for it.  Decent voice acting, an innovative combat system, and a compelling storyline all wrapped up in a pretty package.  

Battles being set to and based on music was cool, and I rarely felt that any given battle song was getting 'old' and tired.  They managed to find a good balance that worked through most of the game.

Definitely worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010016525', 'num_games_owned': 3338, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1386183200}
review: I loathe rhythm games and thoroughly enjoyed Sequence.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056208043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1539442508}
review: Excellent nice time waster. If you just want to sit back, kill a few minutes listening to good music while having something to do, this is the game to go to. The voice acting, RPG element, and the story are nothign to scoff at either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031045410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 982, 'last_played': 1454459991}
review: This is a great and innovative musical-RPG game that must be played by every fans of music games :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198055065605', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1607829325}
review:
Definitely one of the most charming games I have played, and perhaps the best $5 I can ever think of spending.  Before The Echo is a Rhythm-Based RPG: you fight enemies by managing three different screens where directions fall down a la Dance Dance Revolution.  It is incredibly fun with a great learning curve (this being my first game of this genre).  
The game really shines in its story and humor.  Every line of dialogue is voice acted, and the jokes are tremendous.

Think of it as a favor to yourself, buying this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008105254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1449265601}
review: A game with a lot of great writing and some funny bits, Sequence is rhythm + role playing. The battle system is actually pretty challenging, and while I had a different gamepad to use rather than the XBox controller (which has a lackluster d-pad) this game's clever quips and likable characters keep me coming back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999053174', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1355644800}
review:
This game is good. Games like Guitar Hero and DDR never caught my interest, but I still enjoyed this game's gameplay quite a lot. I do, however, like RPGs (so long as they aren't basic, dry, turn based 1980s JRPG battles), and the gameplay here is quite at bit more engaging. Especially later on, you can get some battle strategy going.

Anyway, the rest of the game is good too. The story is good, especially the ending, and the characters/writing, voice acting, the item descriptions (deserves its own mention), and etc. And of course the music. For a music-based game to work, the music has to be good, and it is great here. Check out Ronald Jenkees and DJ Plaeskool and listen to a bit of the music, and if you like what you hear, play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053955163', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1451755018}
review: Rhythm RPG, very well done and funny

author: {'steamid': '76561197962069492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1386407939}
review: An absolute "gem" of an indie title that sucks you in with a combination of a refreshingly deep take on rhythm-based gaming and a superbly written and acted story that keeps you interested through all seven floors of the tower.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025588292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1248, 'last_played': 1385745571}
review:
A great indie game. Every other day a games journalist demands more innovation in the gaming world. Well, here it is: Tap tap-style rhythm game meets RPG. And this game only takes the best of both. Playing Sequence is a delight. Not only do the mechanics work extrordinarily well, the story is surprisingly entertaining, too; quite funny as well as suspenseful, and even a little thought-provoking. The music is superb. 

I love this game.  It's fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004725788', 'num_games_owned': 763, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1330070400}
review:
One of the best games I have ever played. It is not a large scale game with lots of things to explore, no. Just an interesting storyline, simple yet fun concept, enjoyable music, awesome sense of humour and brilliant conclusion. 
It is all these well-crafted and small but meaningful bits that made the game superior to so many games out there.
Definitely a must play!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998697295', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1609, 'last_played': 1438284778}
review: The guys that made this are very clever, I'd definitely suggest this game to EVERYONE out there, and I'm not going to say to "anyone that can afford this" because it's 4.99 and "you can't even play a hand a blackjacks with that money."

author: {'steamid': '76561198016669090', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1426697080}
review: Pretty fucking awesome, a game which exceeds in beeing a real game and a minigame for short breaks

author: {'steamid': '76561198025901072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1409728233}
review: Sequence is probably the first game ever that has combined a rhythm type game with RPG. Make no mistake this is an indie game, the rhythm feature is rather lackluster and the watered down RPG leaves a lot of be desired. The developers claim that this game should take you 12 hours, bullshit. It will take you 6 hours max to beat this game if you skipped item farming. Combine item farming with the rather limited collection of music and you are in for one hell of a repetitive ride. Luckily this game makes up for all of its errors with its impressive voice acting; the various bosses you meet have various distinct personalities that make them super memorable. The game presentation is also very beautiful and organized. The music, although limited, is ridiculously catchy. Finally the game base price is five dollars that alone negates every negative thing said about this game! Go buy it and promote creative indie development.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988827286', 'num_games_owned': 2857, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1466423301}
review: It basically plays like DDR but with a keyboard. If you think that sounds fun, then get it. Otherwise, I can't really recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010964930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1523487943}
review: Kind of a werid game. It's like DDR meets Final Fantasy. It's pretty fun, takes a little time to get started but it's damn addicting.. Great for fans of Rhythm games and RPGs. It's pretty funny too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002099193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1330243200}
review: This is a fantastic game... it mashes rhythm and rpg elements together and does it very well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005699285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1328515200}
review: I've never been a fan of rythm games, but the additional layer of choices provided by the RPG elements enhances gameplay a lot. Recommended, specially considering its really low price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978309871', 'num_games_owned': 2184, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1538659514}
review: Truly a fantastic game. Fun, smart and totally worth it... especially if its on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962947191', 'num_games_owned': 728, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1384652106}
review:

„Çπ„Éà„Éº„É™„Éº„Éá„É¢„ÇÑ„ÉÅ„É•„Éº„Éà„É™„Ç¢„É´„ÅåÂ¶ô„Å´Èï∑„ÅÑ„ÅÜ„ÅàÂº∑Ë¶Å„Åï„Çå„Çã„ÅÆ„Åß„Åã„Å£„Åü„Çã„ÅÑ„Åì„Å®„Åì„ÅÆ‰∏ä„Å™„ÅÑ„ÄÇ

author: {'steamid': '76561198000987626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1441068299}
review: For fans of Stepmania, DDR, or other similar rhythm games, Sequence offers an interesting twist to keep gameplay interesting. In addition, the game has a unique brand of satirical, self-aware humor that pokes at sacred-cow RPG traditions and Internet jokes alike. Since it combines the RPG and rhythm genres, it can get very repetitive, but if you cn keep yourself interested, it makes for a great time, especially considering the low price. Thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999823834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1445988058}
review: This is an extremely fun game. Just like how Puzzle Quest: Challenge of the Warlords introduced RPG elements to make Bejeweled better (and succeeded), the introduction of RPG elements to the music game genre made it better as well. Grinding is a little tedious, since each monster you fight has one specific song they use, and you will need to fight it multiple times to get all the items necessary for crafting, but with only a few exceptions, the songs are ALL good. The game is stable, the art style is pretty cool, and the voice acting is funny at times. It's easily worth $5, especially if you like music games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968387914', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1532380333}
review: The music's great, the gameplay is fun, there's a good bit of challenge with the difficulties, and I still got to see if it can be played with a dance mat!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992555227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1325836800}
review: This game is simply amazing. If the idea of stepmania/DDR-like gameplay blended with rpg elements and a good story sounds good to you, get this game now. You can easily get a good 10 hours of gameplay here and even more :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967992446', 'num_games_owned': 1178, 'num_reviews': 544, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1384460334}
review: What you need to play this game well: An additional peripheral. This is mainly because fingers-on-the-keys Dance Dance Revolution is boring as hell. If that isn't an issue for you, the MMO style grind and the constant DDR-ing to cover up for the lack of other gameplay elements may be the killers instead. Not to mention the dialogue was written in an annoying Brenda Hampton (of 7th Heaven) -style 'edgy'. Basically, fuck this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013562873', 'num_games_owned': 2285, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1645645736}
review: Sequence is one of the best indy games on the market. It is an rpg/rythm game that will blow your mind right up until the last beat. The backgrounds are hand drawn and done very well. The voice acting is SUPERB and on par. The story is hilarious with lots of laugh out loud moments that will have you busting your gut. Sequence is a fantastic game for rpg fans, rythm/music fans, and fans of good stories with humor. It also features music of ronald jenkees. One of my favorite electronic artists. The songs fit the game perfectly and do a great job of setting the mood.  I also highly recomend using a controller, but the keyboard controlls work nicely as well. Don't miss out on such a fantastic adventure. ~PR0XIDIAN

author: {'steamid': '76561198009204214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review: Awesome game, it's like an RPG where you battle with a Flash Flash (Dance Dance) Revolution style thing. Super duper unique, really nice songs too! Get this if you like music games!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994662237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1387973622}
review: Well worth it for the soundtrack alone, never mind the humor and unique take on the DDR formula.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961167439', 'num_games_owned': 1579, 'num_reviews': 720, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1395354375}
review: If you've ever seen or played Dance Dance Revolution, that kind of sums up the fundamentals of this game. But it is slightly deeper than just hitting the right button with the song rhythm because they throw in some RPG elements like spells, armor, and weapons alongside some basic character stats like hit points and mana. The music is the strong part of the game although so far it's been mostly techno type stuff. The story is vague and dumb. Overall, it's a bizarre attempt at mixing these two game genres together and the execution comes off pretty weak. It's definitely different...I'll give it that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012844356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1451339116}
review:
I've gathered a whole folder of games which are crap. This is one of them.
It's just BOOORING. And I'm not good at it. Which is the single most valid reason to call it bad. Amirightorwhat?

author: {'steamid': '76561197981119102', 'num_games_owned': 2973, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1854, 'last_played': 1384376113}
review:
Great music, good voice acting -- especially for an indie venture -- and a very nicely written story. The story is intriguing, especially later into the game, and the characters are hilarious. Dialogue is snarky and well-written, and had me laughing a lot. In my opinion, the only thing truly lacking was the gameplay, which was a little weak. I only played on medium, and it was challenging by the end of the game, but the content was repetitive.This isn't so much a problem of difficulty, but more a byproduct of the game's small pool of resources compared to many other rhythm games.

All in all, as a cheap-ass game it's a nice buy. It makes for an especially nice deal during Steam Sales and the like.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993221024', 'num_games_owned': 639, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1333004400}
review:
So this is pretty great for $5. DDR/Stepmaina, except 3 times at once, with RPG elements. Music is solid, art is pretty awesome, writing is pretty funny, voice acting holds up well. Gameplay is very solid, gets fairly hectic when you're trying to juggle defense and offense at once.

Think Jewel Quest but instead of Bejewelled, it's Stepmania. Good purchase for $5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019230432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1328342400}
review: If you like music and cards buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040278434', 'num_games_owned': 2538, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1425712969}
review:
When I saw the two Videos on Steam I was instantly caught.
Rythm based RPG - Check,
Interesting humour - Check
Fully Voiced - Check
Good, original OST - Check
And 10 hours of gameplay (not including completing the trophies) is insanely good for that price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982702581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1363071600}
review: Rather unqiue rythem game, if you've ever played stepmaina using a keyboard you should recongize the combat system a bit.  You basically get three feilds, one to rebuild mana, one to block attacks from your oppenent, and finally the last feild is for attacking with spells, all of which is timed to the tempo of the song.  Each spell uses a different sequence of steps as well. Each level you are collecting ingredents to make a key to continue on, or other items to help you in your quest. The caracthers are fully voiced, and are very charming and humorous.  At the price of some starbucks coffee or some meal you can't really go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026581192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1326096000}
review:
You wouldn't think I'd like Sequence, given my proclivity for RPGs, sandbox games, and turn-based strategy.
You might, however, change your mind, not only because I led my review by saying 'you wouldn't think', but also because it is pretty much an RPG with the mechanics of a rhythem game. Which sounds sort of repellent when I say it that way, but I'll just reiterate how great it is.
For one thing, the combat mechanism is ingenious, forcing you to choose between offense, defense, and the ability to actually do anything, meaning that you can't just turtle up, you have to be doing multiple things at once. This is complicated by restricting you to a certain time limit to resolve your combats. When you factor in the occasionally crippling difficulty (especially if you joined me in suicide and started on the hardest difficulty setting)...shit's hard. Which is great.
For another thing, it has a pretty decent story behind it (and not a few dramatic twists), and some quirky ARG elements behind one of the achievements, which I thought was a fun touch.
Of course the RPG elements are only in the sense that you can 'level up' and 'have an inventory', but the decision between taking levels and ensuring crafting successes is another cool touch.
I highly recommend this game if you like games with a solid story, and even more if you already like rhythm games by themselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025824483', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1391357072}
review: With unique gameplay and an engaging story, Sequence is a gem among indie games. The intelligent, fully-voiced story, great visuals and soundtrack and the interesting blend of two otherwise distinct genres make this game more than worth its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001505481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1326787200}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004574493', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1430533851}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050644264', 'num_games_owned': 1385, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1384376956}
review: I'm not much of a Rythm Game player but this game is just fun! I like the added RPG elements(anything with leveling up really interests me :P) like leveling up and crafting and the combat is quite fun. The music is good and provides challenge for both casual rythm gamers(like me) and hardcore players alike(at least I think it would :P). The story is quite interesting and the dialogue although a bit hit and miss is written quite well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006238716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1384546757}
review: I won this game and it's not that bad how it looks.I really like sense of humor, story and songs in this original game

author: {'steamid': '76561197997237088', 'num_games_owned': 1564, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1327996800}
review:
For anyone who has ever enjoyed a Dance Dance Revolution kind of game at any level, there is an appropriate difficulty setting in here for you. And on the easiest setting it may even appeal to fans of RPG without any sense of rhythm. It caters to the whole range very nicely. And since it lets you change the difficulty as much as you want for the first few levels, you can play around until you find what is comfortable for you before it is locked. But keep in mind the tutorial is the same easy difficulty regardless of what you have chosen, the real level starts after it, of course. :)
And the music is pretty nice too.

I enjoy this game, and recommend it for any and all of the above.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995820083', 'num_games_owned': 1824, 'num_reviews': 583, 'playtime_forever': 1198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1436424175}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994315242', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1385519873}
review: Very good Rythym game with some outstanding music by Ronald Jenkees.  Like DDR meets Rock Band sort of game, but with you having to manage 3 different 'lanes' - one for mana regen, one for defense and one for casting your spells. author: {'steamid': '76561198015024065', 'num_games_owned': 718, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1327046400}
review: Brilliant and addicting combination of rhythm and RPG elements driven by fantastic art, music, great story, and voicing. The humor is well done and does not overly abuse internet memes as typical of many indie games. Replayability and extras are limited (unless you opt for a higher difficulty, I started on the highest), but the game is well worth one playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963358811', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2427, 'last_played': 1396871600}
review: Fantastic game! More than 30+ hours of very entertaining gameplay, excellent music, an engaging storyline, and an overall great experience! Can't wait for a sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025013888', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1385611211}
review: Considering that this is a blend of rhythm games and RPGs, my two favorite genres, I don't know why it didn't catch my eye on day one. The general gameplay involves switching between three play fields - one to gain mana to cast spells, one to actually use the spells, and one to defend against enemy attacks. It's the kind of concept that must be played to get a good idea of, but let me tell you, it's great. Most of the gameplay music is by Ronald Jenkees, who I now know to be a fantastic artist. While the ending is a bit lackluster on all accounts - a tad 'what the heck?', a bit of open-endedness, even on the secret ending, and a special achievement that might or might not really bug you (I was fine with it, and rather liked it) - Sequence/Before The Echo is an indie game that you need to buy right this second. Just be ready for tons of horrible puns.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999120693', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1387200400}
review: Best of rhythm and RPG gameplay, with cool songs and artwork.  It's definitely worth buying :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198026251802', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1385004741}
review:
Ever played StepMania? This game plays a lot like it, but with three different planes you can switch between, and a nice side of RPG experience point earning with an interesting story and tons of laughs. No, really. Within five seconds I was already in love with this game because of the banter between Ky and Naia. The ending isn't what you would expect, either, and will have you going ".../what" along with the characters. The music is great to groove out to, there are four difficulties for the musically (dis)inclined, and the background art is beautiful.
A little caution if you're against people joking around 80% of the time and making pop culture or using memes. You aren't able to choose the songs that you can play, outside the three you're given for a level, but thankfully the songs never get annoying.
All in all, it's a pretty fun game, and is well worth the $5 you pay for it. Even the credits are worth listening to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042356353', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1326614400}
review: A very different sort of game.  Play rhythm sequences to cast spells and win battles.  I found it very difficult at first and almost gave up but once I got the hang of it I played through the game in about 10 hours.   An interesting change for the norm - quick and fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054623334', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1496154591}
review: DDR style RPG that seems a little over-whelming at first, but you soon get the hang of it. Set for all sorts of abilities from the "musically challenged" to a humourously "spazmodic" ("for the socially challenged"). As well as some entertaining and realistic character "banter", the monsters you need to beat and the items you need to collect give you that semi realistic feeling that it is actually set in the present day. Definitely one of the best indie creations out there at the moment.

review:
Als je iets hebt met ritmespelletjes en je houdt wel van een aardig verhaal is dit echt een aanrader. Verhaal is nog verassend goed en hoewel het spel in de basis vrij simpel is word het toch vrij hectisch gemaakt

Qua moeilijkheids niveau, op easy is het goed te doen. Op de hoogste graad word het een behoorlijke uitdaging dus dat aspect zit ook zeer zeker in dit spel. 

Is dit spel in de sale voor minder als 2 euro ? Gelijk kopen. Ik heb zelf negen uur in dit spel gestoken en heb er nog geen seconde spijt van deze aankoop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006714243', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1325491200}
review:
LOL. For first 2 hours.
Urgh for next hours.
Darn... for next 2 hours
FUCK for the rest of the time.
This game have very funny cutscenes and is fuly voiceacted. But it is so hard you probabaly will not complete it anyway. Too hard to be a music game. If you have a ton of time and are not afraid of listening to the same song for 100+ time IN A ROW (because you will on normal difficulty), then by all means. But I am not sure...

author: {'steamid': '76561198036600335', 'num_games_owned': 1631, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1221, 'last_played': 1384330311}
review: This is an amazing game -- no joke -- you owe it to yourself to play this game.  At five bones you simply can't beat this (although I picked it up for less than two bones during the Xmas sale).  It's worth owning for the soundtrack alone.  Buy this game.  You won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006830013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1379621436}
review: Sort of like the Slap Happy Rhythm Busters of RPGs-- except the dance-rhythm part is actually integral to the game.  The music is pretty rad, the story works, and the gameplay is fun.  I haven't hooked up a dance mat, but I can't help but think it would be fun every time I play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000710580', 'num_games_owned': 720, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1174, 'last_played': 1385585817}
review:
Imagine playing DDR while using 3 boards to play 3 player at ones, Although thats alittle harder, Sequence plays by using the arrow keys and q and e to switch between 3 boards, Magic, Damage and Mana boards. While you dont take damage in the Mana board, Its important to watch your other boards. Magic is where you can do damage to the other player, While Damage is that other players attack,
Its a bit short overall, But has 4 different difficulties.
I would recommend it to anyone who likes rhythm games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986553417', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1510453625}
review:
Wow, surprisingly addictive gameplay.  I think I've put more hours into this than my GH/RB games that are currently collecting dust.  The RPG elements really keep you pushing forward to get better gear and move up the levels to finish the story.  It's also one of the only rhythm games for the PC that pretty much nails the accuracy - I was starting to wonder if that were possible.  You're able to calibrate to your monitor/speaker settings so you'll have an accurate game no matter what system you have.  It doesn't require a demanding computer, either.

Easy mode is fairly easy while the harder levels provide plenty of challenge for experts.   Ronald Jenkees' music is very catchy.  Gamepad (i.e. Xbox Controller) is highly recommended. As long as you have one and you like rhythm games, this will be the easiest $5 you'll spend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970343967', 'num_games_owned': 2864, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1395358421}
review:
You know, I've never been a fan of rhythm games, but this tempted me during the christmas sale of 2011. The game is very simple, but strangely addictive. Sure, it doesn't have a great deal of longevity, nearly no replay value and feature in grinding elements... but it is also cheap, witty, fresh, and the grinding can be mostly avoided unless you're OCD about getting EVERYTHIIIING like I am. Even then, some items near the end of the game increase the drop chances of stuff, so if you're patient you can avoid the worst part of the experience.

What you have, in the end, is a simple yet very accessible game, with a handful of Ronald Jenkees music, dry wit, and a fairly predictable yet ensnaring story. I've definetely made worst purchases for ¬£4. OH WAIT, I bought it during the sales, so it was only ¬£1. EAT IT.

No really, eat it. It is delicious. It tastes of sarcasm, minus the bitter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013486119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1384627779}
review: A surprising hit, expecially for the price (1.24 on daily deal).  Combines ddr rythem game with RPG.  You have three fields that can have arrow markers fall and you need to juggle between them to defeat monsters.  You have a "Defense" field to prevent damage, a "Spell" field to cast spells, and a "Mana" field to regenerate mana.  Maintaining the fields can be a challenge, but very fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975626809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1402878759}
review: When it comes to music games, a genre that has been beaten to death, Sequence is a breath of fresh air and mixes both rhythm and RPG elements. author: {'steamid': '76561197999635784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review: This game's pretty cool, being kind of a mix between Guitar Hero and Dance Dance Revolution, with you pressing arrow keys to the beat of admittedly catchy music(you'll end up replaying fights so much, those songs will eventually become mind-numbingly boring), and some classic rpg statistics and battles thrown in. It plays pretty intuitively, although it can be a little complex, and the difficulty doesn't seem to scale very well, as the settings are awkwardly simple, boringly simple, and from there are just horrendously complex, especially when first begining the game. Most noticably, the dialogue and voice acting are absolutely superb. that alone makes it worth the ride. I cannot emphasize the humor enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980618599', 'num_games_owned': 1052, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1963, 'last_played': 1544150077}
review:
Rhythm game meets old-school turn-based RPG. This is every bit as peculiar as it sounds. The music is slick, much of it licensed from capable hands such as the wonderful Ronald Jenkees, and the gameplay can be quite punishing on higher difficulty levels. I would recommend playing this game witha controller, and indeed have not checked if it is possible (or enjoyable) without.

You'll be switching between three sets of scrolling DDR style arrows: one for incoming damage that is blocked by accurate hits, another (typically containing the most difficult pieces of the song) recharges your Mana pool on accurate hits, and a third for spells. Spells are cast with the right analog stick, which (after a delay) sends down a specific rhythmic snippet that changes it's tempo to fit the current song (the specific direction of arrows changes every time you cast, and the difficulty level also changes the spells, making the more complicated versions of the same basic rhytmic idea). 

The game has you madly flying between these screens to defeat enemies before the song ends--it's one wierd, wild ride and it's well worth it. Battles are tense and fascinating, and there's a lot of room for varied play styles in your spell collection of choice as well as a lot of room for growth within the broad difficulty span. There's even a practice mode where you can just play through the full songs in a more standard rhthym game format. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027446195', 'num_games_owned': 1779, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1330156800}
review:
This is actually a very interesting RPG game. It has DDR-style arcade action which is well distributed in a very challenging format between protecting yourself, casting spells, and regaining mana; all done separately. The first few monsters weren't so tough to battle, but after the next couple levels in, it gets right down to pure skill and let me tell you, it gets rough. You need to be on your feet and have good hand/eye coordination to get the right buttons down quick enough.

Oh yeah, and the music isn't half-bad either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040008779', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1385, 'last_played': 1517690805}
