author: {'steamid': '76561198024753980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1412665335}
review:
If I had heard someone say they were going to make an RPG that used Dance Dance Revolution as a combat system, I would have checked to make sure someone hadn't switched out my coffee for decaf, because there's no way something like that could actually happen.  And yet, this game exists.

I'm not going to lie, there is a bit of a learning curve at first, but once you adjust to the (surprisingly smooth) concept of managing three different DDR boards at once, all in different fashions and priorities, the game really flows well.  The story is interesting, and the descriptions and names of the items you get really show how much the developers enjoyed making the game.  Speaking of the devs, they read the credits at the end, which plays out as more of a DVD commentary than a bland credit list.  This was actually the first time I've really cared about a credit sequence for anything, ever, so props to them for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042192224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1418456200}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962016682', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1325491200}
review:
Description:
Interesting game with well voice-acted dialog sequences. The game is like an RPG mixed with DDR (or other Rhythm games) but for your fingers.

Difficulty:
The screenshots and videos make it seem a lot more complicated than it actually is.  I'm playing on Hard, and it's rather difficult, but there are 2 easier difficulty settings and one harder one, so it's been designed for people of all skill levels.  There's a tutorial that seems to comprehensively cover the game mechanics.

Controls:
You can play this game with a keyboard, but I'd recommend that you have an XBOX360 controller to play this game as it seems to be designed for it.  I don't think you can use a dance mat to play the game; it requires more buttons than are typically on mats.

Price:
For $5 this is a pretty good deal if you like rhythm games. I've played for about 2 hours and am on the second out of seven levels. However, so far there have only been around 4 different songs, but the game does randomize a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025596448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1385142206}
review: I really have to amend my previous recommendation.   This game is good, but it's not as great as I thought it would be.  The lack of RPG elements beyond combat and item use really kind of hobbles the game. This would be great if it fell back heavily on the rhythm game aspect of the game, because that genuinely shines.  The problem is, there are only a very small handful of songs.  Very small.   Each area, you don't get random encounters, you get a small stable of enemies to CHOOSE from.  Combat gets you items to combine into the key that gets you to the next area.  You will fight these same enemies over and over until you get the drops you want, playing through the same light airy techno/electronic music over and over.  The artwork is beautiful, if amateurish (it looks like it's hand painted by someone's really artistic friend), and the dialogue is fan-fucking-tastic, and delivered very sarcastically and deadpan.  But this doesn't stop the actual gameplay from getting really tedious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995528519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1330156800}
review: Way more fun than I ever expected it to be. I am not a huge fan of rhythm games. But I installed Sequence for the 2011 Winter Sale achievement and the next thing I knew 2 hours of my life had vanished. The gameplay is incredibly fun and surprisingly engaging, the music is great (even if you typically don't like this genre or music, as I don't), and the dialogue is genuinely really funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994641567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1326009600}

4 on 5

author: {'steamid': '76561197971502433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1368774000}
review:
Personal fan of rhythm sync games like Rock Band, G. Hero, DDR, DJ Portable, etc. but this, in a nutshell, is just SO much better. It's not about nailing every note or playing dozens of songs in a music library. It just makes the genre so much more interesting by having that RPG element that weaves itself into the story and gameplay so surprisingly well. The humour is just right up my alley as well. 

 Bought it on sale, would have paid full price for the game no questions asked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049429678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1441415778}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968834820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1434777627}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995705668', 'num_games_owned': 1804, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1608567798}
review: This is a rhythm-based RPG. It sounds odd, but it is put together perfectly. The game is hilarious too. Almost every item description is comical, and the exchanges between the main character are often filled with meta-humor about RPGs and video games. Watch the "how to play" trailer for a good taste of the humor. The fights are well-executed; once you get into a rhythm of defending, casting, defending, regaining mana, casting, etc. in a smooth flow, they feel very satisfying. It's worth the full price, but pick it up while it's on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027141673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 84, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1710279376}
review: A rhythm game / RPG mashup; the soundtrack is varied with some very catchy tunes, and the controls are quite easy to get the hang of. Very unique and very enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030193439', 'num_games_owned': 843, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1325232000}
review:
Watch the Launch trailer. Convinced? -> Buy it.
Not convinced? -> Watch the "How to Play" trailer. Convinced? -> Buy it.
Not convinced? -> Watch Total Biscuit's "WTF is Sequence?" on YouTube. Convinced? -> Buy it.
Not convinced? -> Buy it just on my recommendation :). It's awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969593119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1386434592}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002122389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1035, 'last_played': 1413523091}
review: Great for anyone who likes rhythm games and provides a great challenge. It requires you to switch between 3 different fields constantly to defend yourself from oncoming attacks, pull off different spells to damage your opponents, and regain mana. author: {'steamid': '76561198036761844', 'num_games_owned': 923, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1387223823}
review: Buen art, buena m√∫sica, buenos di√°logos, buena jugabilidad y buen precio. No s√© qu√© m√°s se puede pedir de un juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995465541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1622246318}
review: Sequence is a fresh take on music genre games.  With three note tracks at once, it's more engaging than others on the market (plenty cheaper too).  Made for geeks who generally play RPGs, this game gets it.  Beautiful backdrops with a healthy splash of humor make this an easy game to pick up any time.  The music is pretty fun as well - all electronica, but a good mix of tempos and styles keep the levels from repeating too bad.  Completely worth it's full price, a steal on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991930938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1375655067}
review: Sequence is addictive, hilarious, and clever. It's sort of like DDR and a bit like Frequency, with a light RPG over the top. Naia reminds me a lot of Claudia from Warehouse 13. I love that you can play with a dance pad, too, though I haven't tried it yet. Super fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198022971323', 'num_games_owned': 2600, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1385971828}
review: As soon as I saw the trailer where the developer was narrating, I knew I dug his sense of humor. This indie RPG meets rhythm game is a bit different, but repeatedly makes me laugh. And it's cheap. Buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969316316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1325404800}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005138290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1132, 'last_played': 1452607021}
review:
This game had me hooked from the first few lines - the comedic act between the two characters is enough to reel you in alone. If you like Stepmania/Rhythm Games and RPGs, most likely you'll love this. Not so good a Rhythm games? Easy mode has you covered. Sequence let me combine my love of Rhythm games with the RPG style I crave.
"On a scale of 1 to stop whining, shut your face."

author: {'steamid': '76561197972387619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1455685403}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993045528', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1483852366}
review:
Sequence takes a unique twist on the PC - DDR genre and turns it into an enjoyable experience by mixing in RPG elements.

Story - 9.2 (The story and the characters were very well done and kept me wanting to find out what's going to happen more and more.)

Gameplay - 8 (The game centers around the management of three fields of arrows rather than just one. The difficulty scales nicely and the bosses are a nice touch to the music-rpg theme. The item drop percentages and item-grinding might turn you away a little bit but it is not that bad.)

Music/Sounds - 9 (Enjoyable songs and sound effects but definitely could use more songs to add more of a mix and make it feel less repetitive.)

Overall - 9

Replayability - 2 (Not much to be replayed here, just achievements and same game different difficulties if you want.)

Worth it? - It's 5$ and very well worth the buy.

-Minor Spoiler - I'd also recommend you to listen and watch the ending credits, they were entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970632271', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1485, 'last_played': 1518342008}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011734271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1663392856}
review:
Have you ever played DDR or Rock Band and was left with the feeling of wanting more. This game is for you then. It features a brilliant battle system to say the least, with streamlined  RPG elements, great music to play and listen to, topped off with decent voice actors speaking surprisingly well written humorous dialog.

Note that this game was meant to be played with a controller. While you could still easily enjoy it with a keyboard, a gamepad would do you a great improvement.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972344486', 'num_games_owned': 1388, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1130, 'last_played': 1420231310}

review:
*2011* This game is very addicting and fun. It is a puzzle game that corresponds to music. The only other game I found more fascinating than this is the little fishing one with magnets!

*Update 2023* I still love this game. It is incredibly enjoyable and definitely holds up well over time. The game play itself is unique, the story is fun and the voice acting is on point. If you haven't played it yet, you should give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018095117', 'num_games_owned': 1060, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1438132714}
review:
A weird mix of a RPG and a rhythm game, yet an effective one.
Which utilizes 3 beat boxes, a defensive box (imporant), a spell box (important thogh you need to hit all the arrows in order to cast it), and mana box (only when you're out of it).
It's a very simple game, though you may need some strategic spells (which you can select them on the room though you can only choose a limited amount of them) in order to win.
And has a great soundtrack, i recomend it if you like a rhythm game or a RPG game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029700803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1325145600}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047700711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1033, 'last_played': 1618213805}
review: I heard the music and I wanted it...little did I know that I was picking up a game that would combine two of my favourite things together...DDR and RPG...an awesome play for the rythmic, or not, person in your family...

author: {'steamid': '76561197968744627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1405, 'last_played': 1343372400}
review: Well, it's a great little music title. It blends the rhythm gameplay of stepmania with an interesting, if repetitive, RPG story and setting to create a genuinely unique game. It is a bit too much of a grindfest, but for the price you could do a lot worse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010901016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1344063600}
review: Sequence is easily the best indie game I've ever played. Probably the best puzzle game as well. Solid gameplay ranging from hectic, fast-paced DDR walls of pain to suprisingly chill but engaging slower songs. Music from Ronald Jenkees and DJplaeskool is absolutely top notch. Witty dialouge, great story, excellent voice acting, unique art style, I could go on about this game for quite some time, but I'll cut to the chase. This is an amazing game at a ridiculously low price. Buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042992291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1461417872}
review: This is a game that is an unusual combination of pattern matching with role playing. The plot is light-hearted yet fun and the puzzles/spells are possible even for those without rhythm (such as myself). This is an impressive effort for an independent developer and is challenging enough to keep me entertained for hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032728080', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1403739498}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009328631', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1402273117}
review: Um √≥timo jogo para quem √© faz de jogos musicais como Guitar Hero, Rock Band, Pump Up e Dance Dance Revolution. √â um RPG que consiste em usar a m√∫sica em seu favor, acertando as setas que descem pela tela para atacar ou defender. O jogo possui tr√™s telas que descem setas, sendo uma dela para esquiva (tela de defesa), ataque (tela de magia) e recupera√ß√£o de mana (tela de mana) e o sistema de RPG por tr√°s que faz o combate. Voc√™ ainda pode conectar uma guitarra, controle ou tapete para pode jogar, fazendo ele se tornar um dos jogos musicais que voc√™ mais goste. Para quem gosta do g√™nero de musicais e curte um RPG, recomendo muito.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993514983', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1385568939}
review: So this is a weird thing we have here, the gameplay itself is somthing I will probably give another go at, the dialogue tries too hard to be witty and trendy. Also the game looks really cheap, I mean I've seen flash games that look more like agame than this. Still it isnt outright terrible nor is it the best thing ever. It just ok, I'd say dont pay the full price but get it while its on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025375592', 'num_games_owned': 2721, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1583656066}
review: With awesome electronic tunes and rhythmic gameplay challenging you at every point, this game is amazing for the price

author: {'steamid': '76561198018356230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 1169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1404163713}
review: Solid gameplay, music, art and voice acting. A large portion of the writing and story didn't do it for me, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008778972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review: lolgaf

author: {'steamid': '76561197970264997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1392548936}
review:
This game is a super fun rhythm game full of neat tunes and attractive artwork. The cast of irritatingly smug hipsters is tolerable and the gameplay is fresh as hell and a fun challenge for anyone familiar with Stepmania or similar fare.

Highly recommended for anyone who isn't a noob, or adventurous types who are.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961566004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review: The dialogue is pretty terrible...like reeeaaally terrible, but for rhythm action fans, it's a fun DDR/RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998508603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1324972800}
review:
This game is a cross between Dance Dance Revolution / Stepmania and Puzzle Quest.

If you reacted to that sentence with "hey that sounds cool," this game is for you. Not certain? Still worth a look.

Playable with the keyboard, a gamepad, or a dance pad (which I really want to try one of these days), the basic gist of the gameplay is hitting arrows in time with a beat a la DDR. For the Puzzle Quest influence, this has an RPG story where you beat monsters to collect items and proceed up a tower. You flip between three "boards": one board's arrows are attacks aimed at you, and clearing the arrow defends against the attack; one board will regenerate your mana; a third board is active when you cast a spell, and nailing that sequence means your spell succeeds.

The dialogue is refreshingly snarky, and fully voice-acted.

The all-important question: how's the music? Very good, and there's a solid variety too. At least, variety within the style - they're all going to be a bit dancy-technoey.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995975965', 'num_games_owned': 693, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 891, 'last_played': 1385293003}
review: The perfect game of this genre. That is all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970213950', 'num_games_owned': 1007, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1324281600}
review: An incredible new twist at the old "Hit button to music" type of game. Engaging, funny, and as difficult as you like it to be. The PuzzleQuest of rythm games! That says a lot!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973331066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1460134270}
review: A great attempt to do something more with with the rythem genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992271177', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1514813396}
review: Hilarious RPG/Rhythm game for dirt cheap

author: {'steamid': '76561198010309380', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1326960000}
review: Honestly, the game isn't...that great. The humour isn't that good, and whenever the girl speaks, I hear mic static, which made me laugh pretty hard. If you like stepmania you might like it, but the design is certaintly nothing amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042749880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1462635070}
review: Well worth the price (especially at 75% off), even if you're not into rhythm games that much. The humor in the plot sells it alone. (Game does not have much replayability, though!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030490247', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1386722522}
review:
A friend of mine actually recommended this game for me quite awhile ago, but i've only looked at a basic gameplay video, and that was it.
Many months later, when i recieved my new notebook, and when Steam started doing huge sales, i decided to include games i was "kinda" interested on to my wishlist, including this game. Then when this game hit 2 euros, i bought it.

Now i'm gonna be honest here. From the boredom gameplay i'm getting from Stepmania, and similar DDR games with no intensity whatsoever, and from there are so many indie games i am "meh" at, i expected this game to be no diffirent.

Turns out i was wrong on many levels. This game surpasses basic expection i thought this will be. Every ingame music i've heard so far are very catchy, the voice acting is spot on and flawlessly perfect, the many internet references (possibly including a pony one aswell) are hilarious, the story is excellent, and most importantly the gameplay is fantastic. Give this a try, and you'll love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039098580', 'num_games_owned': 2071, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1330588800}
review: Una mezcla extra√±a, juego de "rol" con r√≠tmico musical. Pero funciona. Con un estilo muy, MUY casual, Sequence es una linda forma de pasar el rato. Los di√°logos entre el protagonista y "la voz en el parlante" son √°cidos casi al estilo GLaDOS.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973053872', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1490, 'last_played': 1541362406}
review: This game is fucking incredible. Play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000877509', 'num_games_owned': 1263, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1403651527}
review: I never really liked Rhythm games, but this just blew me away. It got a little repetitive, but the characters, the voice acting, and the RPG elements to it make this the first Rhythm game that I would recommend to a friend. Thumbs up to you, Sequence

author: {'steamid': '76561197993793232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1384860722}
review: A fun beat-matching game with a decent story.  All backed by a wonderfully sarcastic sense of humor injected throughout the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977321026', 'num_games_owned': 961, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1325145600}
review:
Like most people on my friendslist, I got this game for free thanks to Feep on NeoGAF. I only recently started playing it, and.... was blown away by it. Everything just fits together perfectly: the gameplay system, music,  story, dialogues, humour, animation... It's such a great all-round package, the game deserves a lot more exposure. It's so much more than just another quirky indie game. 
If you don't already have it, buy it. If you own it and it's in your backlog somewhere, play it now. Trust me, you'll be doing yourself a favour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000138214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1325145600}
review: Has some of the most well written and witty dialogue I've ever heard in a game. Doesn't hurt that the voice acting is also fantastic and every line so far has been delivered near perfectly. The gameplay itself is pretty fun and has me wanting to keep playing as well, but the dialogue is so good that it easily overshadows everything else. Definitely recommend it as a good buy for anyone who doesn't absolutely -loathe- rythm games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961601781', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1325664000}
review:
Surprisingly fun if you've ever taken to a game like DDR, or StepMania. Lots of multitasking involved, and it gets pretty crazy at higher difficulties. It seems to be optimized for play with a Gamepad/Xbox 360 controller, but keyboard and mouse work just as well; it just needs a little extra adjustment.

Also, turn off the voice acting for the early game, unless you feel like rolling your eyes after every line of dialog.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989128443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1329638400}
review:
Very fun voice act, and ofcourse it has a leveling system, and items, To fight the enemy is go with the music, cast spells,and defend and ofcourse get some manna all wih arrow buttons!

GREAT GAME FOR YOUR MIND, you can train yourself, CAN YOUR BRAIN HANDLE IT?

A MUST HAVE!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994484829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1245, 'last_played': 1325318400}
review: A very original RPG!  A fun story line, good voice acting, and an intense battle system.  It's cheap and got me over 15 hours of gameplay!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028442168', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1475450517}
review: Oddly entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974522426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review: It's a compulsively playable rhythm game made by Jonathan Blow wannabes. So the actual game part is pretty good, but between rounds you have to sit through ten minute long talking head cutscenes featuring irritatingly precious Diablo Cody style dialogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971880107', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1428542469}
review: Interesting characters, a good story, costs 5 bucks, and three DDR panels at the same time makes for an interesting game worth every cost.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992948076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1614672021}
review: I may be slightly biased, but I think this game is pretty good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036428314', 'num_games_owned': 729, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1517517983}
review: really good

author: {'steamid': '76561198004409202', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1387686486}
review: What Puzzle Quest did to Bejeweled, Sequence does for rhythm games like DDR. All the music in game is acccessible in the steam files, which is a great bonus (this game introduced me to Ronald Jenkees and I'm glad it did). Buying the soundtrack from Ronald Jenkees himself would cost more than this game does. The gameplay is pretty fun, the game has a sense of humor that I could a few chuckles out of, and right now is only a buck. You can't go wrong...unless you don't buy it, of course.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003029489', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1330329600}
review: Highly recommended for those who like Flash Flash Revolution/Dance Dance Revolution, Stepmania, In the Groove etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008289750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1403413526}
review: A nice combo of the "keyboard DDR" -games of the early 2000's and RPG gameplay. Nice and ironic writing too. "My head feels like it's been stabbed by a hobo"

author: {'steamid': '76561198020325615', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1071, 'last_played': 1578346226}
review: The best way to summarize this game is with 6 letters: DDR RPG. At first glance, I thought it was a gimmick to just infuse an already popular type of rhythm game with RPG elements. After all, how much could you do with a Dance Dance Revolution type of game? Sequence's answer is: a LOT.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992257308', 'num_games_owned': 1120, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1451850520}
review: Good music, witty writing.  If you ever wanted DDR to have a baby with an RPG, this is that game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030237039', 'num_games_owned': 1702, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review: In the same way that Puzzle Quest mixed Bejeweled style gameplay with an RPG, so does Sequence with DDR/ITG and other rhythm games.  The gameplay is definitely unique and enjoyable, but the largest limiting factor is the rather sparse song selection, even though the available tracks are from great artists.  It's worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014886829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review: even if on first look it looks strange, it's a mast-have music game, and for the first time to use an RPG system! great idea, and i'll hope for more to come!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971188385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1324713600}
review:
Un gameplay original, √ßa faisait longtemps!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994584786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review: Combining RPG elements with some stuff out of DDR/Beatmania, this game went in the right direction. Adding some of the amazing music from Ronald Jenkees also went a long way in solidifying this game's place as an instant classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000609987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1451203885}
review: One of the most unique games I've ever played, I really enjoyed it.  Randomness can occasionally be frustrating, especially in synthing items since they cost experience,.  This can result in the game occasionally becoming a bit grindy, especially if you are a completionist.  Still really enjoyed it.  Also, it is extremely cheap, extremely great value for the price they are asking for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988098542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1271, 'last_played': 1324713600}
review: For anyone who loves rhythm games, this is a fantastic indie title that adds a new dimension to  the traditional flying arrow paradigm. It's not perfect, but it's unique sense of humor and engaging gameplay make it well worth the purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969380319', 'num_games_owned': 4147, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1387978069}
review: Story-based RPG-lite adventure with a unique DDR style battle system. Great writing, especially for an idie game, elevates Sequence from a charming diversion to an experience worth checking out for anyone interested in how mashing up gameplay ideas and compelling narrative can form something greater than the sum of its parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991699186', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3976, 'last_played': 1387995518}
review: Best Indie game i have played so far , with its unique gameplay and fantastic combination of a rythym game and that of an rpg.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968933279', 'num_games_owned': 672, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1452567414}
review: All around a fun game to play on down time, got awesome music featured by Ronald Jenkees and Michael Wade Hamilton. Although the first minutes of the game features cheesy voice acting via tutorial but after that it's awesome music and brain sequencing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970403111', 'num_games_owned': 1501, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1421573471}
review: This Game has an awesome Soundtrack, nice story and a good 4th-wall breaking humor. The controls are easy to learn and hard to master after a while. Pick it up whenever you can!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006637901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1462839822}
review: Sequence is an utterly fantastic game, mixing elements of DDR, and magical strategic attacks with an excellent sound track.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964626206', 'num_games_owned': 2415, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1388206193}
review: Buy it.  Play it.  At least watch the Steam launch trailer, which is amusing.  But yeah, we're talking a fun, catchy beat/rhythm game.  Follow the rhythm to charge up spells!  It's kickass and surprisingly humorous.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992077774', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1394936254}
review: Could use a few more songs and higher drop percentages on the random loot, but overall a fun and innovative rthym/role-playing game

author: {'steamid': '76561198000787174', 'num_games_owned': 1878, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1325145600}
review:
Brilliant little rhythm indie game, can take a while to get used to the controls, but once you do, you'll find yourself getting easily sucked in.
This mixed with some unique twists on RPG elements makes for a truly enjoyable experience, and for such a low price, it's hard to say no.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993378311', 'num_games_owned': 1870, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1324800000}
review: It's a pretty good game! Haven't played much of it at this moment, but it has potential!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968154914', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1412307876}
review: Never thought I'd like a rhythm game but this one still stands out because of how much fun it was back in the day.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975175774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1061, 'last_played': 1387990663}
review: A seeming simple game that combines music, RPG elements and humerous writing.  The player has to fight monsters on their way to the top of a mysterious tower.  The rhythm based gameplay come into effect in casting spells, defending against attacks, regaining mana and learning new spells.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966887453', 'num_games_owned': 2091, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1428098811}
review: This is a pretty awesome game.  It has music by Ronald Jenkees, pretty great writing and voice acting and a pretty cool sort of RPG system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035055810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1265, 'last_played': 1387166765}
review:
As someone who loved stepmania and was addicted to it for a long time this game feels right at home. It includes an interesting mechanic of swapping between windows to attack, defend or regenerate mana which at first takes some getting used to but after that it is like second nature. 

The game includes some great soundtracks, and it was sad defeating an enemy early just because the song would end early. The audio goes perfectly with the visual aesthetics of the game  and the artwork is truly stunning.

There is some farming involved in progressing through the game but if you play any RPG this is nothing out of the ordinary.

Over all it is unique and lots of fun. great music and highly addictive.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982304200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1411, 'last_played': 1337151600}
review: As a veteran of cardinal-direction-centric rhythm games, I found Sequence to be a breath of fresh air in the tired genre. Like the girl of your dreams, Sequence is charming, witty, easy on the eyes, fun to be around, shares your musical tastes (as long as those tastes involve Ronald Jenkees), and won't take all of your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969008933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1665627088}
review: Sequence is an absolute blast. The story is quirky and funny, and the gameplay is very challenging. It is much like DDR for the computer! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197982630449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1325059200}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030633006', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1466966852}
review: As a rhythm game, Before the Echo (formerly known as Sequence) isn't one of the most challenging, but its fun game mechanic, catchy soundtrack and tongue-in-cheek storyline are sure to entertain. And at such a low price, it's quite a big bang for your buck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035370081', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1431557711}

This is a great game!

It's like stepmania on PC with RPG elements and a very selfaware and sarcastic humor. It does not take itself very serious and has its unique dialouge and humor style which is awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970337436', 'num_games_owned': 1086, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1455251913}
review:
Huge bonus marks for having witty writing, great voiceacting, and actually being very funny. Managing to crack even offensively funny jokes is always a plus.

The music content is very good, if a bit on the small side, i'd like to have seen more songs, but i can understand that with a tiny budget like this, it isn't possible.

The game does however get a huge minus for being very buggy (i can understand not liking alt-tabbing very much, but the game crashes often when it loses focus, so no multitasking allowed, not to mention there are some audio issues here and there.)

On the other hand, the game plays hecticly, but is rather challenging and very fun, considering its cheap price, if only for the humor, i'd recommend trying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014839778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1676343484}
review:
OK, So imagine playing three rhythm games games at once. Now imagine you're doing this to advance a fully voice-acted story. Now imagine that on completion, you're not actually done. Imagine that there's one Achievement which drags you forward, playing until your eyes bleed, sure that you've missed nothing. Imagine when you finally figure out what to do to get that achievement, that doing so gives you the very strong feeling that it's nowhere near over.

Good job! You're right now imagining playing Before the Echo!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996115366', 'num_games_owned': 1194, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1384413310}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988672858', 'num_games_owned': 7622, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1384961854}
review:
You like rhythm games? And RPG elements, too? You want to feast your eyes on colourful character and background designs? And you don‚Äôt mind sometimes silly humour? You better not wait to hit that buy button!

‚ÄòSequence‚Äô gives you all this: wonderful music, colourful 2D graphics, silly but loveable dialogue and humour [apart from that Hitler joke maybe], and at its rhythm core a superb game where you‚Äôll learn what it means to multitask.

The RPG element can become a chore at times [keyword: grinding] and a gamepad is very highliest recommended, but that shouldn‚Äôt keep you from playing a game that has so much character in the most positive sense of the word.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969589052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1320044400}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985209709', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1385194303}
review: I dislike rhythm games. I dislike it when they try to encroach upon other genres. But this independently made Music RPG is astounding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005772222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1425697634}
review:
When I say Sequence is "DDR with RPG elements", people give me a funny look.   However, I say that the game is one of the best indie titles I've ever played.  The gameplay takes some getting used to (a whole lot of multi-tasking) but it is well worth it once you step over the learning curve and move into mastering it.  It helps quite a bit that the game boasts a strong soundtrack with the amazing Ronald Jenkees taking up most of the space.

The game is ultimately fun, but it is not without its flaws.  Much of the game is repeating songs over and over in order to get materials for new skills and items.  Grinding may be fun at first, but it can get taxing towards the end of the game.  The story is also something to consider.  Its not terrible, but it isn't very special either.  

Overall, Sequence is a whole lotta game for only 5 dollars.  I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001053123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1325059200}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997629357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1451101371}
review: Sequence takes the traditional crafting and leveling elements of RPG's and mixes them together with Rhythm on three different screens to be shuffled through to maximize your mana-growth, damage and defense. What really makes this game shine is the mass amount of geek humor that covers the entire storyline. One could easily say this is an homage to those early 90's PSX gamers who spent countless hours infront of the TV playing Parappa the Rapper and Bust a Groove. This game is a definite buy for anybody who remembers and enjoyed playing those two games. The only real flaw to Sequence is the general elevator-esque feel to the very little music in the game, and the poorly thought out randomly generated number system that governs the drop rates and crafting rates. It was obvious the fairly annoying RNG was made to prolong the span of what is otherwise a relatively short game.

review: I honestly grabbed this as an impulse by and its actually quite good. Its pretty difficult at first but it gets easier. The best way I can describe it is like a Battle - DDR RPG... Or Puzzle Quest with DDR instead of Bejeweled.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993228530', 'num_games_owned': 851, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1580079089}
review:
If you love rhythm games, specifically DDR, then look no further. Taking rhythm to the next level, you are forced to pay attention to up to three separate flows of arrows at the same time..and all while keeping beat. Utilizing the Dance Dance Revolution style of rhythm game, these arrows shall be used for offense, defense, and recovery as you battle your way through foe after foe.

What can make it particularly exciting is that no two battles are alike: by using your spells at different times, you essentially 'remix' the steps within the song yourself, providing a somewhat-new spin time and again.

Of course, with a rhythm game, you want its soundtrack to shine, and Before the Echo does not disappoint. With a variety of techno-like beats providing you with sweet ear-candy, you'll find yourself swaying or bobbing to the beat as you work to defeat your foes.

We've had Puzzle/Bejweled meets RPG in titles such as Puzzle Quest, and now the rhythm genre seeks to remix..and so far, it's shining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015615629', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1398051551}
review: In the way that Puzzle Quest is an RPG with Bejewled for combat, Sequence is an RPG with Stepmania for combat.  Addictive, fun, absolutely worth the low price.  I beat it in about 10 hours with essentially full achievement completion, so if I were bulldozing through I could probably do it in less, but it's a great way to burn an hour or two a day for a couple weeks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009068740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1319353200}
review:
It's a rhythm game, the songs are all synth-something. Techno for some, jazzy in others. It's got a story, and actual voice acting, and clever dialogue. 

It's also $5. Cheaper during specials, so it's worth it. I wouldn't play this game often, but it's actually pretty funny, the humour is snarky and full of pop-culture references, and it goes out of it's ways to take the mickey out of hipsters. So you know. Score!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045888198', 'num_games_owned': 1330, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1380604580}
review: Awesome and fun rhythm game that has RPG battle elements. The system is similar to DDR or Stepmania but you are switching between three fields to attack, defend and restore mana. The storyline is well written and amazingly voice acted and all topped with witty intellectual humor and cultural references. Definitely a must own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004745068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1014, 'last_played': 1399768107}
review: Very fun game.  As a fan of DDR and of rpgs, this gets the best of both worlds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042852203', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1443, 'last_played': 1596926540}
review: This game combines Rythm with RPG and it does it so well that I would heartly recommend this to anyone even remotely interested. Who wouldn't pick this up at such a price, and I got like 18 hours of gameplay out of one playtrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046056615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1278, 'last_played': 1432275699}
review: Nice game if you like RPGs, but also like stepmania type games. Combines the 2 nicely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031387636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1733, 'last_played': 1682562564}
review:
Sequence is an interesting game wich mixes DDR with rpg elements. As you unravel the curious story of Ky, a man trapped inside the misterious Tower, with no idea how he got there. The gameplay is rhythm based (in the vains of ddr or guitar hero), but you have three "lanes" between wich you keep changing in order to attack, deffend and recover your mana. Sounds weird, well it is, but it's fun (even though I'd recomend a xbox controller to play).
    Now, the game starts really pretencious about its own plot, and about how "different" it is. Usually this is bad, but this is one of the rare ocasions where I'd say it's okay, considering the plot is interesting, well voice acted, and the gameplay is inovative (if a little grindy on the serach for crafting materials).
    Finally, the great attencion to details seals this deal for me, you can change not only your difficulty, but the speed your notes run at. Plus, you can listen and play any song you've discovered on the extras menu. If it wasn't for a lack of in-game volume controll I'd have nothing to complain about this Interesting, and quite underrated Rhythm based RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031925706', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1386627750}
review: /tcag

author: {'steamid': '76561197960598694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1338, 'last_played': 1389221775}
review: Wer den Guitar Hero Style mag, kann bei Sequence noch einen Level an Komplexit√§t drauflegen. Oder zwei, denn in den h√∂heren Schwierigkeitsstufen wird's hektisch! Das gemischt mit gut gemachter Musik und der Tatsache, dass sich Sequence definitiv selbst nicht ernst nimmt, ergeben ein unterhaltsames Spiel f√ºr zwischendurch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011512390', 'num_games_owned': 1455, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1384343182}
review:
How to even describe Sequence? It's a kind of RPG with a DDR-like combat system, where you earn experience to level up or spend it to learn new spells and craft new items.

And the end result is pretty good with solid gameplay mechanics, a fair level of challenge, an interesting story with well-written dialog and a really great soundtrack (which is essential, given the nature of the game).

Also, it's dirt cheap, so if this kind of game seems even remotely interesting to you, then you should definitely get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995133463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1325232000}
review: I have never laughed and/or facepalmed so many times in one game (sorry, Magicka).

author: {'steamid': '76561197988420377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1540, 'last_played': 1506729472}
review:
epic game is epic.  think of stepmania, combined loosely with RPG elements (namely equipment, and crafting)  a little farming required, but its loads of fun

not to spoiler much, but the 'ending' is a little preachy.  but overall, full of fun dialouge and if you like 'rhythm' games (DDR, ITG, guitar hero, etc) its more than worth the cost.

not to mention supporting an indie developer that has some great ideas~

author: {'steamid': '76561197995552872', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1351148400}
review: So good

author: {'steamid': '76561198019017253', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1448511811}
review: So great! Sequence is like to rhythm games as to what Puzzle Quest was to bejeweled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001222053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1610777928}
review:
This is a really neat little game. For all you rhythm junkies, this game is definitely worth the price. The battles might seem a bit overwhelming at first, given that you have 3 fields to take care of, but it gets easier once you find a good strategy to work with. Although the gameplay might get a bit repetitive if you have bad luck in crafting items, it doesn't seem to feel like im "grinding" just to get past an area. The script is actually pretty funny, it maintains a good balance of humor and mystery, and while a few jokes/gags might slip by, the game does well to not take itself too seriously.

Overall, its a fun little rhythm game, with some crafting and battle/magic system that is challenging, but not frusturating. Like rhythm games? Definitely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961026507', 'num_games_owned': 2105, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1435980177}
review: Very enjoyable rhythm based rpg game, makes battle very active and very rewarding.  Definitely worth playing if you enjoy rhythm games or just like rpg type games with an interesting story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031995156', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1419197249}
review: A great game made by an idie dev named Iridium Studios. This is an awesome mix between rythem and RPG. The voice-arcting is great and the art style is really cool. The tunes are probably my favorite part though. Anyways, it's only five bucks so show your support for indie developers and shell-out the dough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027174954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1396733574}
review: This is what would happen if phat beetz could slay things. Yeah. You know you like the sound of that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013204609', 'num_games_owned': 3200, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2577, 'last_played': 1544649340}
review:
One of the best indie games I've ever played, it's a very nice rythm game where you have to multi-tast while fighting rhythm battles. Also it's got RPG elements (equipment, leveling and more) as well as a very nice and sweet story with superb voice-acting.
I'm really looking forward to a sequel, and I can only recommend it to everyone. For this price it's a steal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960384100', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1486084936}
review: If you're into beat-matching games like DDR and your general run'o'the mill end-battle screens with experience and levels a la Final Fantasy, this is definitely worth a go. The music is great too, I really liked 'Still Crunchy'. I recommend playing it with a controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993122868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1320825600}
review:
Sequence does what Puzzle Quest did for block-clearing puzzlers but for the music/DDR-eque games.  The RPG elements and items collecting added to my music genre is a breath of fresh air and just what this genre needed.

In this game you have not one, but 3 stream of arrows coming at you, one is health, another is mana and one is for spell activation.  The gameplay is very addicting and the music is varied and fun to listen to while playing.  With such a low price, there is really no reason to miss out if you like rhythm games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991429078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1435533428}
review: A must-play for anyone who calls themself a fan of rhythm games. Great value for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040409638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1206, 'last_played': 1384458379}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198049681923', 'num_games_owned': 728, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1700686573}
review:

those who played gutair hero or stepmania will love this game due to the simliar style. i wish not to say much about the game but it has witty humor, a perfect combat system and battle system (for being different that is) as well as lovely music and other internet refferences.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025906672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review: $5 for a voice acted, 3-panel rythm game to nothing but Ronald Jenkees songs. Oh and it's an RPG. With boss battles. In two words: Fuckin' fresh.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993293926', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1418473881}
review: You play as Nocturne and scream DAAAAAAAARKNESSSSSSSS all the time or something

author: {'steamid': '76561197993929060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1692503031}
review: Think Puzzle Quest, but with DDR instead of Bejeweled.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993190984', 'num_games_owned': 800, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1320649200}
review:
Sequence is a bold game. It seeks to stride across the threshold of gaming and give you a slap on the behind. While it accomplishes this, with it's Rhythm baised RPG-ness, it is also a game that suffers from the traditional flaws of RPG's.

In Sequence, the storyline is that you know nothing and by playing the game you learn things. This alone is not worth it, so the characters make witty jokes, puns and whatever else to try keep you amused during this festival of boredom. The problem is that much like with any RPG, you have to grind, and grind you must. In sequence, this involves playing songs over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over  and over

author: {'steamid': '76561198019765747', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1027, 'last_played': 1356076800}
review: If you like music and rpgs this game is for you, gameplay is abit like guitar hero but the music is great, story is good too, all voice acted and such, good stuff ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197963688296', 'num_games_owned': 1534, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 1083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1529727974}
review: Take one part puzzle quest, one part stepmania, and one part....I dunno what! But you get this, you're either going to like this title because you like rhythm games and want to try something a little different or you hate rhythm games and have no soul. Expect much swearing and cursing in the midst of your enjoyment as you fail to learn a spell or beat a foe, by just THHIIIIISSSS much!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995228810', 'num_games_owned': 2699, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1598075724}
review: It's a five dollar Stepmania RPG with fantastic music, good humor, and fully voiced cutscenes. It's really, really good. Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003999386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review:
A really interesting and fun take on the traditional rhythm game. Managing a few different windows at once makes for a much more complex (and for me, fun) experience on the computer since playing with a controller makes arrow pressing a ton easier (at least for me). 

I'm not sure how much I'd recommend it based off plot. It has a good story, that is well-written, but there's a section towards the middle where I just wanted to say "Yes, I get it, you don't believe in astrology, get over yourself now and stop pounding it". I had similiar resentment near the end, where what I wanted was to just smack down the final boss and the whole scenario instead of just letting it go like the characters seemed to. It did get a bit of thought out of me, which was probably the point, so good job there. 

I suppose mostly I just keep going back because it's mechanics are really solid. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197976599923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1329897600}
review: A fun and simple game with RPG elements that make this game slightly addicting. It's essentially a Battle-DDR, but with a creative storyline and witty references. I find it quite entertaining to play in between classes and arcade-worthy. Highly Recommended to casual gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973261574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review: An interesting and enjoyable game! The gameplay is different but familiar for any rhythm game player.  You switch between three screens in order to attack defend and gather mana for spells all while keeping in time with the arrows that are coming down ala DDR.  It takes a while to get used to it but with practice it becomes fast and involving.  Most of the featured battle music is from Ronald Jenkees of Youtube fame. His music is very catchy and keeps you on your toes but sadly it would have been nicer to have a little more music available.  There is some "grinding" involved when it comes to gathering ingredients to craft more useful spells and weapons/armor so it may get tedious for some, but this game is best played in short bursts anyway.  It might be too easy for veterans of the rhythm genre so I recommend hard or higher for a real challenge.   Overall it has around 10-12 solid hours of gameplay and is worth the 5 bucks especially if you're a rhythm game fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000044325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 942, 'last_played': 1403709390}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999599511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review: A brilliant mix of RPG and rhythm games, with great electronic music and bloody good art.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968901565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1384462506}
review: What a sweet game. You can really tell how much love went into making it. Even the credits are wonderful. Definitely get this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970225777', 'num_games_owned': 1414, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1618954404}
review:
Great rhythm game with some epic tracks, and some that dont quite hit the mark. The set of music contains mostly Ronald Jenkees music which is a bonus if you like his style but could put some people off.

 The game itself provides a great twist to the standard rhythm game, it adds RPG elements and monster battles. Sounds weird but it works. You have to keep a balance between doing damage, casting spells, and protecting yourself at the same time. There is quite a lot of voice acting, some less than perfect segments but overall good.

If you like rhythm games you should definitely check this one out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978172057', 'num_games_owned': 995, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1611021056}
review: Everything about this game is amazing. Buy it. Right now. I dare you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006097811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1489, 'last_played': 1622426562}
review: Sequence, while short, is a very invigorating indie game.  The combination of music, defense, and spell casting merge seamlessly.  The arrows match the beat of the music making the experience feel almost rythmic,  Casting spells isn't just click and it's done, you have to execute a small sequence to complete it as if you were actually casting it.  To regain mana you can access a mana pool in which you execute an almost "Guitar Hero" esque sequence, each note giving back mana.  Lastly you can defend against enemy attacks the same way you cast, just on a different screen.  The three screen technique is not at all taxing, in fact it seems almost instinctive.  While adding to the challenge, it makes the experience all the more wonderful.  If given enough practice you can switch from all three screens easily casting, defending, and regenerating quickly and efficently --  which the game slowly introduces with tougher and tougher enemies.  Overall Sequence is a solid indie game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006590203', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review:
This game is a combination of sex and chocolate wrapped up in a videogame. Seriously. Buy it. It's worth every cent and more.

Not good at rhythm games? Well, son, best get good at them and buy this. You'll thank yourself. The ladies will too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988663774', 'num_games_owned': 3540, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1398009961}
review: This is a great game if you hate rhythm games and want to prove that they suck by playing one with impossibly bad controls and no good music. Otherwise, it's a pretty terrible game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015089284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1375416184}
review:
This is the best Indie game I've played in a long time. Great gameplay, good story, awesome music and voice acting GALORE! If you're a fan of rhythm based games like stepmania or the like, I highly recommend you pick up a copy of this game whenever you can. The best part of this game is that you can keep all of the music you play and who wouldn't want to take some of these amazing soundtracks and put them on their Ipod. Overall, this was a very satisfying purchase because of the unique twist of RPG and music elements fused together to make this game superb.

Oh and did I mention Ronald Jeenkes music is in here? it's bad ass

author: {'steamid': '76561197979675662', 'num_games_owned': 2290, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1708896204}
review:
This game has a really interestring concept and successfully mixes rythm game mechanics with that of an RPG.  Note I have not gotten very far into the game, this review is on the first hour or so of gameplay.

The writting is very good, if you enjoy dry, sarcastical humor, example House MD, then you will love the back and forth dialog in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024259068', 'num_games_owned': 1514, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1389527911}
review: If you've ever enjoyed DDR or anything else in that genre, you'll absolutely love this game. Even if you're not a hardcore rhythm game player the humor is awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999611064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1319612400}
review: Guitar Hero had a baby with Puzzle Quest.  Best played with a 360 controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024958741', 'num_games_owned': 1504, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1325232000}
review:
Do you like DDR / rhythm games? Particularly the finger derivatives (i.e. Stepmania)? Do you like RPG / Puzzle genre benders? (i.e. Puzzle Quest)

If you answered 'Yes' to either of those questions (bonus points for 'Yes' to both), then you will ALSO like Sequence. 'Love' might be the correct verb there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000524902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1320562800}
review: Sequence is a very different kind of experience. Essentially an RPG where you fight using a rhythm game. The voice acting is pretty good, funny writing / dialogue, decent crafting system using XP for fuel -tacks on some extra grinding, but I don't mind- all makes for a great buy at under five dollars ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197992903915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1319612400}
review: get this its fun and cheep

author: {'steamid': '76561197976313504', 'num_games_owned': 1166, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1696142528}
review:
I was sceptical with this game. I can DDR, but don't like stepmania or any of those keyboard-equivalents. Having said that, this is pretty addictive and the RPG element stands out. It isn't explained very well in the description - you're basically being set up to fail on the 3 boards, you can't possibly hit all the arrows, and that's fine (one to stop being hit, one to get mana to cast spells, one to successfully cast a spell - most arrows are on the mana board, which doesn't matter if you miss arrows until you need a refill). 

It's a very bizarre concept that somehow works. You get items, make recipes to get new items, eventually make a "key" to advance to the next level. There's 8 levels to the tower, each with 3 enemies, some of which you'll fight more than once (and you'll be okay with it). You're not playing for the music here, the music is just the world you're fighting in.

Very solid $5 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010421706', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1594, 'last_played': 1568484055}
review:
Awesome indie game. It's a mix of RPG with stepmania/DDR/ITG. If you're good at any of these rhythm games, don't let the screenshots and videos fool you into thinking this is too easy. The challenge in this game comes from having to multi task all 3 different aspects of battle (gathering mana, defending, casting spells) and your ability to balance and decide which one to focus on. Its mechanics are also fairly simple and easy to get into.

EDIT:  I just found out this game was patched to fix a bug where the hardest difficulty would randomly get changed to the easiest mode.  Now that I'm actually playing on the hardest difficulty, the charts are kinda hard by themselves but the battles are outright brutal now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990858256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1254, 'last_played': 1325059200}
review: Two radically different games mashed together into a quirky and witty experience. Sequence provides a fun experience through innovative mechanics and well written dialogue. Whether you are a casual gamer without much rhythm or a soulless StepMaina freak, there is a difficulty setting just for you allowing for a broad range of enjoyment.

review: Zwar Durchgezogen mit (gelungenem und sarkastischem) Humor hat es dennoch eine zwar leichte aber ernste und meist gut vertonte Story. Das Gameplay ist hektisch aber motivierend, alle Mechaniken auf den Sammeltrieb aufgebaut und die Musikauswahl stimmig. Leider (da 2 personen-Studio) mit Gegner und Musikrecycling. Das PuzzleQuest der Rythmusspiele und die 4‚Ç¨ defitiv wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997289603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1444522117}
review: Do you like DDR?? Do you like RPG elements?? Then this game is for you!! The perfect mash-up of a rythem game and an RPG, complete with a good story and some witty dialogue. But that's not even the best part, IT'S UNDER $5!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000983191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1533689066}
review: Neither as bad, nor as difficult as it has the potential to be. The play mechanics make it fun, the music is pretty good, and -- holy crap -- the voice acting doesn't suck! The writing is a little uninspired and the tongue-in-cheek moments try a bit too hard, to no avail, to save it. Still, interesting how a different spin on the usual formula not only takes a bit of the bite out of the ol' RPG grind, but makes it enjoyable... which is good. Because, really, level grinding is just about all there is to this game.

Misturando uma jogabilidade de jogos musicais (√† la Guitar Hero, Dance Dance Revolution e afins) com um sistema de combate agil, visual atraente, trilha sonora cativante e uma historia bem estruturada, Sequence consegue mostrar-se mais um grande jogo Indie no mercado. - Altamente recomendado a todos os apaixonados por jogos.
